column1: Don't worry. The US military are the most experienced. They know how to limp home.
The best part is that they know , nobody is gonna believe they just "hit an unknown object" what was it? Sponge Bob's house? Of course it was a warning...
Very strange…..those subs have the most sophisticated GPS and sonar known to man. How they didn’t detect the object it hit is beyond me??

I've been following this issue for quite some time now, and I'm glad to see that you were able to cover the issue so fully. For years and years, the situation between the Philippines and China deteriorated under the radar because of all the broken promises of finances and public works projects. As soon as China knew that the Philippines would never break off ties with the US fully (as much as Duterte toyed with VFW agreement, full knowing that the US was his last defense considering our underwhelming navy), they already knew they would merely be using the Philippines and not actually partnering with them. If you look at projects that actually got started or finished, many were in areas Duterte's party needed to increase support. In the end Duterte is really turning out to be a modern-day Marcos, pulling the wool over the public's eye with superficial projects and big promises
they should start by stop calling the region SCS and address it by something appropriate like South Asian Sea or something that doesn't include China in its name.
Good investigative report! Good job CNA! Fair and balance report. Thank you so much for being honest and fearless. More power to CNA!
A channel with real journalism for once! Thank you Wionews.
reminds me of World War Two , lot of the old allies getting back together .
This report was so damn good I almost got up off my chair so I can start applauding !!

0:50 If anyone is wondering "United States Marine Corps fighter jets aboard a British aircraft carrier flew combat missions over the Middle East this week -- the first time US warplanes have gone into combat from a foreign warship since World War II, the United Kingdom's Ministry of Defense said on Tuesday." That's why you see the US marked F-35s on the deck

It is ridiculous that most of the warships in South China Seas are coming from countries outside East and South East Asia.
ASEAN countries should turn them all away and insist that the region is not for military conflict.
Just wanted to compliment the way the report has been written and how well spoken it is! Great job!
It would be absolutely safe, for all other countries to roll out their Navy forces along with them.
I think renaming the "south china sea" is a good place to start. Calling the region "south china sea" is like implying that it's China's or belongs to china which is the root of the issue.
China: "We have our own court."
As Indonesian, ASEAN need to be strong!
GO! GO! GO! INDIA... a very wise decision... Thank you so much for the support... Lots of love all the way from the Philippines....

Not strongest but with this latest carrier, it has still  enough sting left on its tail! Brits aren’t braggarts and they aren’t impulsive. They know what they are doing. Very advanced in AI and high tech warfare. Still a powerful navy to reckon with.
Waiting for the US 7th fleet to join them. It will be fun.
Correction: Germany is sending a ship, but so has France a member of the EU, and the UK, still part of Europe but not the EU, has sent even more.

I think this is less about freedom of navigation and more about upholding international laws(like illegal fishing and trespassing). Also for a video about Germany there are a lot of people hating on the US lol. China is a big bully in the the region and is the regional super power, someone needs to step in and say enough is enough. If people aren't happy with the US and their allies being involved than you better be happy with over fishing to the point of extinction, Taiwan getting invaded along with many other small countries(South Korea) a long with all the other things the CCP brings with them, like slave labor, organ harvesting, concentration camps, extreme police brutality, and an extremely oppressive government with only their best interests.

I love how no one talks about China building military bases on reefs.

One of china's big problems is access to the open seas.
They are largely a land-locked country, and their coastline is surrounded by other island nations.
If war broke out, they could be relatively easily cut off from the rest of the world, denying them shipping and supplies.
"Even though these islands may not look like much" - they're very beautiful in an ecological sense-  and you're right, they are worth fighting for, just not in the way you probably meant it.
Every country on south east asia should unite and form a huge country
The Philippines finally showed that they are willing to protect their waters and is putting pressure on China finally.
This is good news. We must stand strong against china's tyranny.
I love this anchor. Her way of putting the words out is brilliant.
Love it keep up the great work from AUSTRALIA good quality news coverage

That joint VTOL strike group would run rings around the china Navy on its own , and that's not including the other numerous VTOL and fixed wing  coalition force carriers in the region, what makes this different , is its F-35 and their ability to create a kill web of sensors and shooters with its fully sensor integrated battle space networking capability allowing it to operate in tandem from well over the horizon and strike targets beyond the range of its own ships sensors

The scenery is so beautiful and stunning.Very enjoyable! Reminds me of my trips where I take the good music like the Guns N Roses, Imagine Draongs or the Delta Parole and then enjoy the powerful feeling of the sea. ¡vamos!
The greatest pride is the army for me. Mistakes mean accidents, loss and mean life. it shouldn't happen from our own mistakes.
The damage must be pretty serious for the top 3 officers to be sacked.
This is a top of the line Seawolf submarine. If i am not mistaken, there are only 3 of them in US military inventory. This is indeed a big blow to the US navy.

I don't buy into the excuse about hitting rock. A rock that could damage a submarine, must be a massive one. If US high tech submarine could not detect a standstill massive rock, how could it detect enemy's subs miles away? I'm more into it was bumped by something moving, and purposely.

That's quite something for three abreast.
'Suction' between ships at sea can be a risk and so need to be able to quickly break away to avoid damage of collision.
Those F-35s are amazing
Lovely our Dutch Evertsen is their tohether with the great carier. Even after brexit European coutries work together in the best possibel way
